title: 6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Galaxies Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
summary:
6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Galaxies Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Date: Jan 13, 2025 | Source: Times Now

This article showcases six breathtaking images of galaxies captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting advancements in astronomical imaging.

  • The Antennae Galaxies captured with Hubble's advanced imaging capabilities.
  • Messier 106 visualized combining Hubble data with contributions from amateur astronomers.
  • The Large Magellanic Cloud depicted beautifully, emphasizing its spectacular hues.
  • Messier 94, located 16 million light-years away, showcasing its intricate beauty.
  • NGC 3256, a galaxy noted for its unusual features, captured in detail.
  • NGC 4522 illustrating the process of ram pressure stripping affecting the galaxy.
"These images not only capture visual beauty but also contribute to our understanding of the universe's structure and formation processes."

In conclusion, the Hubble Space Telescope continues to amaze us with its ability to capture the beauty and complexity of galaxies, inspiring further exploration and study of the cosmos.
newTitle: Stunning Hubble Space Telescope Images of Galaxies

title: Mahakumbh 2025 live: Holy dip performed by 1.5 cr devotees on first day, says UP CM - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025 Begins: 1.5 Crore Devotees Take Holy Dip on Day 1

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The 45-day Mahakumbh Mela 2025 has commenced in Prayagraj, attracting an estimated 1.5 crore (15 million) devotees on its first day. The event is set to be the largest gathering on Earth, with stringent security measures in place.

  • 1.5 crore devotees are expected to take holy dips during the festival.
  • Major bathing rituals (Shahi Snan) scheduled on January 14, January 29, and February 3.
  • Comprehensive security and health arrangements have been made, including the presence of around 40,000 security personnel.
  • Traffic and parking arrangements are optimized for the influx of visitors.
  • Special trains from various states have been announced to assist pilgrim transit.
“The world's largest spiritual and cultural gathering, Mahakumbh 2025, commenced on Monday in the sacred city of Prayagraj.” - UP CM Yogi Adityanath

The event underscores India's rich spiritual heritage and aims to promote national unity while ensuring the safety and comfort of all participants.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025 Begins: 1.5 Crore Devotees Take Holy Dip on Day 1

title: Magnitude 6.9 earthquake rattles southwestern Japan, tsunami warnings issued - Moneycontrol
summary:
Magnitude 6.9 Earthquake Hits Southwestern Japan, Tsunami Warnings Issued

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

A powerful earthquake with an initial magnitude of 6.9 struck Japan's Kyushu region, prompting tsunami warnings for the affected prefarctures.

  • The earthquake occurred at 9:19 PM local time.
  • Tsunami warnings were issued for Miyazaki Prefecture and nearby Kochi Prefecture.
  • The extent of the damage caused by the earthquake is currently unknown.
  • Japan's geographical position along the "Ring of Fire" contributes to its frequent earthquakes.
The Japan Meteorological Agency reported that the earthquake had an initial magnitude of 6.9.

The earthquake's impact is under assessment, and authorities are monitoring for potential aftereffects.
newTitle: Magnitude 6.9 Earthquake Hits Southwestern Japan, Tsunami Warnings Issued

title: Watch Live As NASA Astronauts Upgrade the ISS and Hunt for Microbial Life - SciTechDaily
summary:
NASA Astronauts Conduct Spacewalks to Upgrade ISS and Search for Microbial Life

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: SciTechDaily

NASA astronauts are set to embark on two critical spacewalks in January to upgrade the International Space Station (ISS) hardware and search for microorganisms.

  • First spacewalk (U.S. Spacewalk 91) on January 16, lasting 6.5 hours.
  • Second spacewalk (U.S. Spacewalk 92) on January 23, also lasting 6.5 hours.
  • Tasks include replacing a rate gyro assembly and collecting surface material samples for analysis.
"We aim to explore and understand better what exists on the surface of the ISS." - NASA Operations Integration Manager Bill Spetch

These missions demonstrate the ongoing maintenance and research efforts vital to the ISS's functionality and safety.
newTitle: NASA Astronauts Conduct Spacewalks to Upgrade ISS and Search for Microbial Life

title: Japan issues tsunami advisory after 6.9 magnitude quake - The Hindu
summary:
Magnitude 6.9 Earthquake Hits Southwestern Japan with Tsunami Advisories

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: The Hindu

A strong earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.9 has struck southwestern Japan, causing tsunami warnings and evacuation orders in affected areas.

  • The earthquake occurred at 9:19 p.m. local time, with its epicenter in Miyazaki Prefecture.
  • Tsunami advisories were issued for Miyazaki and Kochi Prefectures.
  • No immediate reports of significant damage have been received.
  • Tsunami waves of approximately 20 cm were detected at Miyazaki Port.
  • Japan's geography on the “Ring of Fire” makes it prone to earthquakes.
“Residents in the coastal city in Kochi were told to evacuate as a precautionary measure.”

The event highlights the ongoing seismic risks in Japan and the preparedness of its public safety measures against such natural disasters.
newTitle: Magnitude 6.9 Earthquake Hits Southwestern Japan with Tsunami Advisories

title: Ashwini Vaishnaw fact-checks Mark Zuckerberg over India polls remark: 'Misinformation' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ashwini Vaishnaw fact-checks Mark Zuckerberg over India polls remark: 'Misinformation'

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw criticized Mark Zuckerberg's remark that India's ruling party lost major elections, stressing the importance of factual accuracy during discussions.

  • Vaishnaw refuted Zuckerberg's claim about India's elections, highlighting the victory of the BJP in the 2024 general elections.
  • Zuckerberg suggested a global trend of incumbent losses due to various factors, including economic policies and pandemic responses.
  • Vaishnaw stated that over 640 million voters reaffirmed their trust in PM Narendra Modi's leadership.
  • He called for maintaining facts and credibility in discussions, especially from influential figures like Zuckerberg.
"Let’s uphold facts and credibility," Vaishnaw stressed.

The exchange emphasizes the impact of misinformation in the digital age, particularly from high-profile individuals.
newTitle: Ashwini Vaishnaw Addresses Zuckerberg's Misinformation on India's Elections

On India-China border situation, Army chief rules out ‘buffer zones’ along LAC - Hindustan Times
summary:
Army Chief Discusses India-China Border Stability and Disengagement

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi stated that the border situation with China is stable but sensitive, denying the existence of buffer zones along the Line of Actual Control (LAC).

  • Both Indian and Chinese armies completed disengagement at Depsang and Demchok in eastern Ladakh last October.
  • General Dwivedi emphasized the need for a broader understanding to rebuild trust.
  • Verification patrolling has been successfully conducted by both sides.
"It is stable but sensitive... overall, both sides will remain back and will not go to the common areas because we still feel that if we meet at those places, the violence level may go high." - General Upendra Dwivedi

This ongoing dialogue and military disengagement are crucial for maintaining peace along the contentious border.
newTitle: Army Chief Discusses India-China Border Stability and Disengagement

title: HCL Tech Q3 Results: Net profit rises 5.5% to ₹4,591 crore, revenue up 5% YoY; dividend declared | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
HCL Tech Q3 Results: Net profit rises 5.5% to ₹4,591 crore, revenue up 5% YoY; dividend declared

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

HCL Technologies reported a 5.5% increase in net profit and a 5% rise in revenue for the Q3FY25. The company also declared a dividend as it marks 25 years since its public listing.

  • Consolidated net profit reached ₹4,591 crore.
  • Revenue from operations for Q3FY25 rose to ₹29,890 crore.
  • Interim dividend declared: ₹18 per share, including a special dividend of ₹6.
  • New deal wins for the quarter were $2.1 billion.
  • Updated revenue growth forecast for FY25 is now 4.5% to 5% in constant currency.
“HCL Tech is well positioned as AI-led transformation brings new opportunities for growth.” - Roshni Nadar, Chairperson, HCL Tech

The results reflect HCL Tech's strong performance and confidence in future growth driven by AI and digital offerings.
newTitle: HCL Tech Q3 Results: Profit and Revenue Growth Noted

title: Stock market crash: 5 reasons why Sensex tanked by over 1,000 points - Hindustan Times
summary:
Stock market crash: The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) benchmark index Sensex tanked by 1,048.90 points to close at 76,330

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On January 13, 2025, the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) saw a significant drop in the Sensex index, falling by over 1,000 points due to various negative market influences.

  • The crash was largely attributed to unfavorable global market cues.
  • Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) sold off equities worth ₹2,254.68 crore.
  • The rupee fell to a historic low against the US dollar, exacerbating market conditions.
  • Brent crude oil prices surged above $80 a barrel, raising inflation concerns.
  • Upcoming budget expectations contributed to a restrained market sentiment.
“Rising crude oil prices would raise concerns of a spike in domestic inflation, which could further delay any rate cut hopes from the RBI in the near to medium term.” – Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd

This dramatic drop in the stock market reflects broader economic uncertainties and highlights the interconnectedness of global events affecting domestic markets.
newTitle: Reasons Behind the 1,000 Point Drop in Sensex

7 foods that one should never consume in winter season - The Times of India
summary:
7 Foods to Avoid in Winter

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The article discusses seven foods that are detrimental to health during the winter season, emphasizing dietary choices to optimize well-being in colder months.

  • Certain fruits can cause digestive issues in winter.
  • High-fat foods may lead to sluggishness.
  • Cold drinks impair digestion, making warm beverages more favorable.
  • Foods with high sugar content can weaken the immune system.
  • Excessive dairy consumption might trigger respiratory issues.
  • Processed foods lack vital nutrients and energy.
  • Avoid excessive consumption of red meats that can increase inflammation.
“Eating right in winter is crucial for maintaining energy and health.”

In conclusion, being mindful of dietary choices during winter can enhance overall health and immunity.
newTitle: 7 Foods to Avoid in Winter for Better Health

title: 92 HMPV test kits arrive in Jamshedpur, testing to begin today - Avenue Mail
summary:
Jamshedpur Receives 92 HMPV Test Kits to Begin Testing

Publication Date: Today, Source: The Avenue Mail

In light of the increasing cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) across the country, Jamshedpur is preparing to confront the potential health threat as 92 test kits arrive for testing.

The testing will start on Monday, with the focus on early detection to prevent the virus's spread.

  • 92 test kits have been supplied to the Virus Research and Diagnostic Laboratory (VRDL).
  • Testing for HMPV will start on Monday.
  • Five suspected patients will be tested weekly as per ICMR guidelines.
  • No confirmed cases in Jamshedpur yet, but readiness is key.
  • The district is ramping up surveillance efforts to monitor potential cases.
“Updated information about the HMPV virus is continuously coming in. We are preparing accordingly.” - Dr. Diwakar Hansda

The authorities are closely monitoring the situation, with further guidelines expected as new cases are identified.
newTitle: Jamshedpur Receives 92 HMPV Test Kits to Begin Testing

title: Kumbh Mela | At Prayagraj, an encounter with naga sadhus and tent stays - The Hindu
summary:
Kumbh Mela 2025: A Grand Spiritual Gathering at Prayagraj

Date & Source: January 13, 2025 - The Hindu

The Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj, known as the biggest religious congregation in the world, is taking place with heightened excitement due to a rare celestial alignment occurring only once in 144 years.

  • The Kumbh Mela 2025 is expected to attract around 40 crore people.
  • The Triveni Sangam, where the Ganga, Yamuna, and mythical Saraswati meet, is a key pilgrimage site.
  • Sadhus from various parts of India participate, setting up camps along the riverbank.
  • A significant increase in religious tourism has led to luxury accommodations being arranged for attendees.
  • Devotees are advised to approach the event with humility and reverence.
“Now it’s more of a show than a kumbh,” says Mahamandeshwar Ji Maharaj of the Juna Akhada.

The Kumbh Mela offers a unique blend of spirituality and community for millions, marking an unforgettable gathering amidst the picturesque backdrop of Prayagraj.
newTitle: Kumbh Mela 2025: A Grand Spiritual Gathering at Prayagraj

title: Why rupee breached 86 against US dollar: strengthening dollar, weak FII inflows - The Indian Express
summary:
Why the Rupee Breached 86 Against US Dollar: Strengthening Dollar, Weak FII Inflows

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Indian Express

The rupee fell past the 86 mark against the US dollar on account of a strengthening dollar and weakening foreign institutional investor inflows, amid rising crude oil prices.

  • The rupee opened at 86.12 and hit a low of 86.31 against the dollar.
  • Factors leading to this depreciation include a strong dollar and high crude oil prices.
  • The US jobs report showed NFP at 256,000, outpacing expectations.
  • Capital outflows from Indian markets have reached approximately $4.2 billion in January 2025.
  • The rupee is expected to trade within the range of 85.80–86.50 in the near term.
“This sustained decline reflects a combination of global and domestic pressures.” - Amit Pabari, Managing Director, CR Forex Advisors
newTitle: Why the Rupee Fell Past 86 Against the US Dollar

Indian fighting for Russia killed in Ukraine war, deceased hailed from Kerala: Report - Firstpost
summary:
Indian from Kerala Dies Fighting for Russia in Ukraine War

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

A man from Kerala named Binil TB has died while fighting for the Russian military in Ukraine. This report highlights the recruitment of Indian nationals to the ongoing conflict, often through fraudulent means.

  • Binil TB was 32 years old and hailed from Thrissur, Kerala.
  • His relative, Jain TK, was injured in the same incident.
  • Officials from the Indian embassy in Moscow verbally confirmed his death.
  • Binil's family reported that he died in a drone attack.
  • Indians recruited for military roles often find themselves on the frontlines despite being promised non-combatant jobs.
  • Ajith Kolassery from NORKA ROOTS mentioned there is a lack of formal information on the incident from the Ministry of External Affairs.
“Mentally and physically, we are exhausted. We have been pleading with local commanders for our release.” - Binil TB

This incident raises concerns over the plight of foreign fighters in Ukraine and the deceptive recruitment practices used by the Russian military.
newTitle: Indian from Kerala Dies Fighting for Russia in Ukraine War
